description.narrative: Fawry for Banking and Payment Technology Services SAE (Fawry, the Company), is the first and largest electronic bill payment platform (EBPP) in Egypt. The Company was established in 2008 with the objective of facilitating payments on a ubiquitous electronic platform. Its extensive network footprint with more than 10,000 points of presence allows (a) consumers to pay bills or top-up their mobile phones and (b) businesses to pay for goods and services. Fawry has invited IFC to invest up to [US$6.0] million in equity to finance the Companys growth and help support the Company in (i) continued expansion of its network within Egypt, (ii) service and product development and (iii) sales and marketing (together the Project). The Project would result in 16,000 additional points of presence and number of new products offerings, including business to business (B2B) payments.

The project will have the following development impacts: - Create an efficient, reliable collection infrastructure for billers; - Provide consumers with a convenient, reliable and secure payment option; - Facilitate trade by reducing transaction costs and overcoming geographic barriers; - Extend financial inclusion by reaching unbanked populations with limited access to traditional banking services; and - Signal to the market, that Egypt has viable and innovative early stage companies that can attract venture funding.
